title: Inside the Trump Administration’s Push to Prosecute James Comey
summary: President Trump’s campaign of retribution began to intensify in mid-July and hit a fever pitch over the last week, culminating in the indictment of one of his foremost enemies.

title: Examining James Comey’s 2020 Testimony at the Heart of His Indictment
summary: The charges against the former F.B.I. director center on an appearance he made before a Senate committee in September 2020. Here’s a closer look.

title: Greene, Straying From Trump, Reflects an Emerging MAGA Split
summary: The right-wing Republican congresswoman from Georgia has grown disillusioned with her own party and with President Trump, and increasingly willing to say so.

title: Fear and Hope in Venezuela as U.S. Warships Lurk
summary: On a visit to Venezuela, The Times found a nation bracing for potential U.S. military action.

title: With Scant Information, Federal Workers Brace for Possible Shutdown
summary: After a tumultuous year of staffing cuts, government employees now face the prospect of going without pay — or facing even more layoffs.

title: Trump Says He Has Ordered Troops to Portland, Oregon, to Protect ICE Facilities
summary: The president characterized Immigration and Customs Enforcement facilities as being under siege from domestic terrorists.

title: Des Moines Schools Superintendent Arrested By ICE Is Placed on Leave
summary: School Board members in Iowa’s capital made the decision one day after immigration officials accused the superintendent, Ian Roberts, of being in the country illegally.

title: What the Public Memory of Charlie Kirk Revealed
summary: For those who felt denigrated by his rhetoric, the bipartisan tributes to him as a champion of free speech augured something dangerous: the mainstreaming of formerly extremist views.

title: You Asked for More of Mel Taub’s Puzzles. Here Are Three.
summary: With his Puns and Anagrams puzzles, Mr. Taub made solvers groan and grin for decades. After he died this month, readers expressed appreciation for his work.

title: A Stranger Shattered Their Lives. At First, They Didn’t Know Why.
summary: A family reckons with the devastation left behind after a former N.F.L. player showed up on their property.

title: What Salt Typhoon Shows About the Cyber Power of China’s Spy Agency
summary: Fears of U.S. surveillance drove Xi Jinping, China’s leader, to elevate the agency and put it at the center of his cyber ambitions.

title: Russell M. Nelson, 17th President of the Mormon Church, Dies at 101
summary: He left a career as a pioneering surgeon to become a church leader, diversifying its policies and its senior ranks. He became its president at 93.

title: N.C. Stabbing Suspect Had Many Interactions With Police and Little Treatment
summary: Decarlos Brown Jr. had harbored paranoid delusions for years, yet under state law he was not considered dangerous enough to be treated against his will.

title: How Much Money Do New York’s Mayoral Candidates Actually Have?
summary: Andrew Cuomo appears to be the wealthiest. Eric Adams faces legal bills. Zohran Mamdani owns land near the Nile. Curtis Sliwa splurges on his cats.

title: Forget ‘Love Island.’ Tennessee Has an Isle of Goats.
summary: Eco-grazing goats help clear overgrowth worldwide. But rare is the herd that has to get to work by boat.

title: For His Enemies, the Law
summary: The political prosecution of James Comey.

title: Ta-Nehisi Coates on Bridging Gaps vs. Drawing Lines
summary: The writer Ta-Nehisi Coates joins Ezra Klein on the show to discuss how the left should think about the work of politics and persuasion in this moment.

title: Gunman Fires on Riverside Bar in North Carolina From Boat, Killing 3
summary: Eight others were injured in the attack on the bar in Southport, N.C., the authorities said. The Coast Guard later detained a person matching a description of the shooter.

title: Russia Hammers Kyiv in 12-Hour Drone Assault
summary: At least four people were killed in the attack, which also wounded dozens of civilians in the capital and around the country.

title: For Many Moldovans, Their Election Is a Choice Between Russia and the E.U.
summary: Parliamentary elections in this nation bordering Ukraine come at a critical moment in Moldova’s push for European Union membership.
